Generally, young people in Korea who are gay aren’t really open about it even if they’re in a homosexual relationship as they don’t want to face all the hate from conservatives (who are mostly the older generations). They’re open about it with their group of friends and perhaps even their families, but usually they’re a lot more silent about it than in the west. This is slowly changing with our generation, though. Kpop idols have a lot of pressure on them and careers can be ended overnight because of a scandal, which being gay would be over there. If Jimin, or any other kpop idol, would come out as gay he would lose a lot of korean fans and it would make BTS as a whole look bad and they wouldn’t be allowed to perform in as many places or come to as many variety shows etc. (it sucks but it’s just the way their society works). Because of this companies, like Bighit, don’t approve of idols coming out and they work actively against that happening and hide evidence. They also have no choice but to say what their ideal “girl” is since all male kpop stars get that question because the companies they’ve signed with make them do it, and therefore that can’t be used as evidence for them being straight or liking girls at all. I believe, as a bisexual guy, that most members in BTS aren’t straight (honestly I think Jin is the only one). I think Jimin is either gay or bi, mostly because of how he acts around certain men (like when he was excited over how handsome Shawn Mendes was, and when he wanted to hug that guy for a long time whose name I don’t remember and his overall behavior around him, being flattered when certain men are attracted to him, etc.). But of course we have absolutely no idea until they actually come out. Right now everything we think is just based on assumptions and stereotypes (this goes for both thinking they’re gay or straight, or anything else). Assumptions and sterotypes.. At least for the most part. For example Suga has openly said in a Japanese interview he’s not “limited to girls” and he once rapped that he could make both guys and girls come with his tongue = confirmed bisexual/pansexual. Taehyung has worn a pride shirt and a “legalize it” hoodie, as well as many other things that he’s done and said.. I’m very convinced he’s gay. Short answer: we don’t know until they tell us, therefore we can’t say or assume anything about their sexuality. What I do in every situation when I meet someone is that I just assume the person I‘ve met is “pansexual” until I know for sure whether they’re straight, gay, bi, pan, or anything else. I don’t talk about it with them unless they bring it up or want to share something, and I also don’t say what I assumed and it’s not something i obsess over. It simply doesn’t matter unless you’re trying to get in their pants. Just keep an open mind and don’t expect anything, this goes for every person you meet/see.
